meanings.definition: Fail to fulfill a promise or obligation.
meanings.sent1: He renigged on his promise to help with the project.
meanings.sent2: She renigged on her agreement to meet for lunch.
meanings.sent3: The cat renigged on its duty to catch the mouse.
meanings.sent4: The sun renigged on its pledge to shine all day.
meanings.sent5: The student renigged on studying for the test, leading to a poor grade.

meanings.definition: To go back on a promise or commitment.
meanings.sent1: They renigged on their plan to visit the museum.
meanings.sent2: He renigged on his promise to attend the event.
meanings.sent3: The dog renigged on guarding the house and took a nap instead.
meanings.sent4: The wind renigged on its direction, causing confusion for the sailors.
meanings.sent5: She renigged on her decision to quit, deciding to stay and try again.

meanings.definition: To revoke or retract a statement.
meanings.sent1: The politician renigged on his earlier statement about taxes.
meanings.sent2: She renigged on her comment about the new policy.
meanings.sent3: The weather renigged on the forecasted rain, surprising everyone with sunshine.
meanings.sent4: The company renigged on their announcement of a pay raise.
meanings.sent5: He renigged on his claim of being the fastest runner in the school.
